div1.p:
United States Consulate
at St Paul de Loanda
S.W.C. Africa

L. de R. du Verge
to State Department
Washington D.C.
Destitute Am: Seamen and Petitions of the Am: subjects condemned for Life.
Duplicate copies &a &a forwarded to Don John M. Francis at Lisbon.

United States Consulate
St. Paul de Loanda
Jany. 11th 1883

To Hon: John Davis
Asst. Secty of State
Washington D.C.

I have the honor to state, that I forwarded to Hon John M. Francis Minister Resident at Lisbon; copy of clothing &a issued to destitute Am: seamen forwarded by Portuguese Brig "Trorador" with receipt for their passage &a &a duplicates of which I herewith enclose. I am in hopes that the state Dept: will approve of my actions in this case, to have sent them to Lisbon for $10 a piece instead of Cape de Verde Island for $23 a piece and that only as a great favor from the Capts of the vessel: January, February, March and April; there on hardly any Portuguese vessels which come here, and it would be a great difficulty to send men away from this place during these months if I had any on my hands.

I have also forwarded to Hon John
M. Frances the petitions of the Am: Subject, condemned for life deportation to this place by the Portuguese Authorities; Their petitions are enclosed by the best merchants of Loanda, and I truly hope that their liberty may be granted to them, being now exhausted, with one foot in the grave, having been here since 1869.

I have the honor to be
Sir
Your obedient servant
L. de R. du Verge
US Consul
